edu.ncsu.csc216.collections

Class LinkedList.LinkedListIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.collections.LinkedList.LinkedListIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<E>, java.util.ListIterator<E>
    Enclosing class:
    LinkedList<E>

    private class LinkedList.LinkedListIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.ListIterator<E>
    The LinkedListIterator class thats implements ListIterator. This is used to iterate through the LinkedList and provides methods to make changes to the list.
    Author:
    JeffColeman, GeneTodd, SamuelJessee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      LinkedList.ListNode last
      Stores the next node for returning after changing the list
      LinkedList.ListNode next
      The node following the iterator
      int nextIndex
      The index for the node following the iterator's position
      LinkedList.ListNode prev
      The node preceding the iterator
      int prevIndex
      The index for the node preceding the iterator's position

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinkedListIterator()
      Constructs a listIterator at index 0 if no index is provided
      LinkedListIterator(int index)
      Constructs the linkedListIterator for the given index.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(E data)
      Adds an element to the list and shifts the previous and next nodes for the iterator to compensate for this addition.
      boolean hasNext()
      Checks that the iterator has a node following it
      boolean hasPrevious()
      Checks that the iterator has a node preceding it
      E next()
      Moves the iterator forward one position and adjusts the previous and next nodes based on the new position
      int nextIndex()
      Used to get the index of the node following the iterator
      E previous()
      Moves the iterator backwards one position and adjusts the previous and next nodes based on the new position
      int previousIndex()
      Used to get the index of the node preceding the iterator's position
      void remove()
      Removes a node from the list.
      void set(E data)
      Sets the data for the node following the iterator to the passed in data

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes a node from the list. Resets the previous and next nodes for the iterator to the new nodes surrounding its position. Decrements the size by 1 if a node is removed.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface java.util.Iterator<E>
        Specified by:
        remove in interface java.util.ListIterator<E>
